election_record.label: Vermont 1817 Governor

overview.note: The Official Election Returns tally sheet lists 13756 votes for Jonas Galusha and 7430 votes for Isaac Tichenor; however, the sum of totals per county is 13879 for Galusha and 7603 for Tichenor.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1817, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 17, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 22, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 22, North Star (Danville, VT), October 24, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, and The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT) report 13756 votes for Jonas Galusha; however, the sum of totals per county is 13746.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1817, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 17, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 22, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 22, North Star (Danville, VT), October 24, and The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT) report 7430 votes for Isaac Tichenor.
The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, 7430 votes for Isaac Tichenor; however, the sum of totals per county is 7417.

sub_unit.name: Caledonia
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, reports 337 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Caledonia County.
North Star (Danville, VT), October 24, reports 436 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Caledonia County.

sub_unit.name: Saint Johnsbury
sub_unit.note: The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912, 571, reports 67 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Sutton
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 5, reports 78 votes for Jonas Galusha in Sutton.

sub_unit.name: Walden
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 5, reports 21 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Walden.

sub_unit.name: Westford
sub_unit.note: The results from Westfield were not included in the Official Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, reports 100 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Essex County.

sub_unit.name: Granby
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Granby.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: In 1817, the town of Huntsburgh was renamed Franklin.

sub_unit.name: Grande Isle
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Returns tally sheet lists 203 votes for Isaac Tichenor; however, the sum of totals per town totals is 223.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1817, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 17, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 22, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 22, North Star (Danville, VT), October 24, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, and The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT) report 203 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Grande Isle County.
The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, reports 200 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Grande Isle County.

sub_unit.name: Braintree
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Returns tally sheet lists the 20 votes for Martin Chittenden in Braintree as being for Isaac Tichenor.

sub_unit.name: Topsham
sub_unit.note: The Topsham Town Records reports 57 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Washington Town Records reports 85 votes for Jonas Galusha and 6 votes for Isaac Tichenor.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Coventry.

sub_unit.name: Newport
sub_unit.note: On October 30, 1816, the town of Duncansboro was renamed Newport.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Returns lists 1865 votes for Jonas Galusha and 774 votes for Samuel Strong; however, the sum of totals per town is 1937 for Galusha and 876 for Strong.

sub_unit.name: Benson
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Returnss tally sheet does not have a vote count for Benson. These figures come from Benson Town Records.

sub_unit.name: Danby
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Danby.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Town Records reports 136 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 17, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 22, The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT), October 22, North Star (Danville, VT), October 24, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), October 27, and The Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT) report 784 votes for Jonas Galusha in Washington County.

sub_unit.name: Fayston
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Fayston.

sub_unit.name: Worcester
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Worcester.

sub_unit.name: Halifax
sub_unit.note: The Halifax Town Records reports 104 votes for Isaac Tichenor.

sub_unit.name: Townshend
sub_unit.note: Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont 229, reports 23 votes for Jonas Galusha and 120 votes for Isaac Tichenor.

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.name: Cavendish
sub_unit.note: The Cavendish Town Records reports 179 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Stockbridge
sub_unit.note: The Stockbridge Town Records reports 111 votes for Jonas Galusha.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1817. 195-201.
The Intelligencer, and Weekly Advertiser (Lancaster, PA) (Lancaster PA). October 4, 1817.
Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT). October 27, 1817.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914. 571.
Phelps, James Houghton. Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont. Townshend, VT: G.E. Selleck, 1877. 229.
Wells, Frederick P. History of Newbury, Vermont. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Caledonian, 1902. 357.
